a59-1.notes: E session cost monitoring chain continues (a55→a59→a60). Current avg $2.77 (from 7 E sessions in history), up slightly from $2.66 in A#59. Still well below $3.50 intervention threshold and $5 cap. This is observation-only — no actionable work needed unless costs spike above threshold.

a59-2.resolution: d042 marked completed in s1007. B#274 verified implementation complete with 17 tests for platform-picker.mjs ROI-weighted selection. wq-261 (created by A#59) was completed.

intel.capacity_gate_note: pending_count=5 is at threshold. Intel can auto-promote when queue drops below 5.

intel_promotion_tracking.note: wq-219 (HiveMind evaluation) completed. Need 1 more intel-auto item to reach 3-item tracking threshold.

intel.verdict: HEALTHY - 100% consumption rate. Intel promotion tracking at 50% success (1/2), within tolerance.

ideas: Intel quality metrics for R session digest (~s1010)
brainstorming.verdict: HEALTHY - 3 fresh ideas (avg 5 sessions old), 0 stale.

pending_items: wq-263 (Build component test coverage report tool)
wq-265 (Add success rate tracking to session metrics)
blocked_items: wq-209 (Rotate compromised credentials - d039, superseded by d045)
wq-257 (Address directive d044 - awaiting USDC deposit)
queue.verdict: HEALTHY - 5 pending, 1 in-progress, 2 blocked (human action), 0 stuck.

active_items: d044 (USDC wallet) - acked s995, 16 sessions since ack, wq-257 blocked awaiting deposit
d045 (Regenerate credentials) - acked s1000, 11 sessions since ack, wq-255 in-progress
in_progress_items: d039 (Credential rotation) - superseded by d045, wq-209 blocked on human
directives.verdict: HEALTHY - 40 completed, 2 active with progress, 1 in-progress superseded. All directives have queue items or resolution path.

directive_outcomes.note: d044 awaiting USDC deposit (human action), not addressable by B sessions.

B.verdict: PRODUCTIVE - avg $2.43 (elevated but within cap), queue items being processed. wq-261 completed since last audit.

artifact_compliance.note: All verified E sessions pass artifact check. Phase 3.5 gate continues effective.

E.cost_trend_note: E session costs: avg $2.77, up slightly from $2.66 in A#59. s1008 was $3.38 (outlier). Still within $5 cap. Continue monitoring per a55-1 chain.
E.verdict: HEALTHY - Artifact gate 100%. Cost stable at $2.77, within cap. s1008 cost slightly elevated but acceptable.

structural_changes_since_s1006: R#166 (s1005) - Add queue health check to B session close-out
R#167 (s1010) - Add intel actionability filter to E sessions
R.verdict: EFFICIENT - 2 structural changes since last audit, avg $1.96 (optimal), 0 reverts.

A.verdict: EFFECTIVE - Previous audit had 2 recommendations: a59-1 (E cost monitoring) continues in-progress, a59-2 (d042 stale) resolved.

hooks.note: All 64 hooks pass bash -n syntax check.

credential_files.note: 15 credential files on disk, 25 registry entries. No orphaned files detected.

stale_references.verdict: CLEAN - No stale references to deleted files in active code.

platform_liveness.note: All 3 primary platforms respond via MCP tools.

infrastructure.verdict: HEALTHY - 64 hooks pass syntax, no stale references, 3 platforms live.

d039.blocker: Human confirmed rotation not possible, platforms unreachable
d039.escalation_status: d045 supersedes - credential regeneration approach adopted. wq-255 in-progress for new credentials. Pre-commit hook added to prevent future leaks.

monitors.note: 1 monitor (Chatr API) points to external HTTPS endpoint, no internal IP targeting.

inbox.note: Unread messages are self-sent tests and task-board notifications. No injection patterns detected.

security.verdict: CLEAN - d039 superseded by d045 (in-progress). No suspicious entries. Inbox clean.

cost.note: Overall cost trend stable at ~$2.26/session avg. All session types within caps. B and E costs elevated but not actionable.

recommended_actions.description: Continue monitoring E session cost trend per a55→a60 chain
recommended_actions.action: Observation only. Current avg $2.77, up slightly from $2.66. s1008 was $3.38 (outlier). Still below $3.50 intervention threshold. Check again in A#61.
